NAME.Nominative: Venerable Acepsimas, Hermit of Cyrrhus in Syria (4<sup>th</sup> C)

SAINT.LIFE: He practiced asceticism as a hermit near Cyrrhus, Syria during the reign of Theodosius the Great. Ven. Acepsimas spent 60 years in a rather narrow cave, committed to fasting and continual prayer, and not seeing anybody, and died in peace.
